Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2008 08:31AM LisaG42 wrote: Try not to worry, I know thats hard to do. I had Birads 5, and it came back b9. Best Wishes, Lisa
Posts.Title: BI/RADS CATEGORY 4 debbyroo nowheregirl

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2008 09:38AM LisaG42 wrote: Thanks again everyone! I am feeling much better. I get the path report sometime today, and I am very nervous about it. My Lupus is at full flare right now, and I pray That I have the strength to fight it all. I have been taking it very easy (which is so hard for me to do!) Thank god for the pain meds! I took a shower this morning, and my bandage came off, and oh  my what a terrible scar this is going to leave! I am just lucky that we went on to the ER that night, beacuse my best freind pointed out if I would have went on to bed, I would have bled to death. I am going to switch Drs, I have no trust in this one at all now. The office did try to compress the hemotoma, but they said it had clotted, boy were they wrong. Like I said I am glad to be alive right now. I will post the Path report as soon as I know. Thanks again for all the wonderful support this board is giving me! Lisa
Posts.Title: Very Angry! LisaG42 BessB

Posts.Content: LisaG42 wrote: Has anyone else had to deal with insensitive people making stupid comments? I own my own boutique in a small town, and its out all over town about the surgery I am having tomorrow. My normal girl who works in the afternoon did not show up today.......so I had to deal with all the well wishers, and nosey gossips today. I had one of my customers make a very stupid comment a minute ago (They are just breasts get over it, breast cancer doesn't kill anyone) I know there are alot of super nice people out there, and on here who understand the fear, and anxiety you go through while waiting, but the insensitive people just make me so darn mad! I am angry anyway about the whole mess. Just wanted to vent! Thanks, Lisa Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Very Angry! LisaG42 BessB

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2008 10:47AM LisaG42 wrote: Thank you everyone! I know I will get through this. I am off for my surgery, and than the week long wait for results :( I just want to say thank you very much for your support, and kind words. I will keep everyone posted. Lisa

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2008 09:44AM LisaG42 wrote: Update! I left my Drs office with a hematoma Thursday afternoon. Well about 7pm that night my breast was bleeding, and the hematoma was the size of a grapefruit. Went to the ER where the breast dr on call tried to drain it, and before it was over I had to have emergency surgery! The mammatone cut through a blood vessel, and I was bleeding to death. They had to put me to sleep, and caurtirize the vessels. I had to have three units of blood during the surgery (about a 4 inch incission). I am now scared to death about the cancer spreading. My lupus is fully active right now, swollen lymph nodes, fever, and my hair is falling out real bad again. I am so angry with the Dr. I will get my biopsy results back Monday. Has this happened to anyone else? Sorry to ramble but, I feel like I am living in the twighlight Zone. Lisa
Posts.Title: Very Angry! LisaG42 BessB

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2008 11:00AM LisaG42 wrote: Hi everyone! I was supposed to get the path report yesterday, but the office is giving me the run around. If I do not get it today, I am going in person to pull all my records, and take it from there. My regular MD is furious about the whole thing, and she wants to send me to MD Anderson in Houston. Had a another bad night last night. God I hope this gets better soon. Will keep you posted. Thanks for all your encourgment! Lisa

Posts.Title: results... mixed emotions... erin1 nowheregirl

Posts.Content: LisaG42 wrote: Hi Everyone, I talked to my surgeons nurse today, and they have scheduled a lumpectmy on the 14th. She explained that I will be on my stomach with my boob going through a table hooked up to a mamograhm machine, make a 2 to 3 incission, and they would place a wire in to the pea size cluster of calcifications (BIRAD 5) I do not know how to feel I am preparing for the worst Mom Had BC at 49, and I am 42. I guess I am kinda numb. Anyone else have BIRAD 5? What was the outcome? Thanks, Lisa Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: LisaG42 wrote: Hi, everyone! I was on here last year with calcification's of the right breast turned out to be ADH b-9. I had surgery yesterday on the left breast 2 areas of cluster calcification's about 4 inches apart (bi-rads 4) they also removed a tumor under the breast, and my gall bladder. I am pretty sore today! My Dr is concerned its DCIS, but we want know until the reports come back in a few days. I am concerned about the 3cm tumor that was under the breast has anyone else ever had that? If this turns out to be DCIS whats next? Any help would be appreciated! Thanks, Lisa Log in to post a reply
